availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel B. Wallace (Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer. South Carolina native. Married to Ann M. Wallace. Father of Helena Wallace, Eugene Wallace, Edward Wallace, Robert Wallace, Andrea Wallace, Emma Wallace, and Ann M. Wallace. Farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Owned twenty-three enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, p. 50.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, p. 50.
